Beyond Expectations

Xerox | Design Lead | 2006

I was asked to design graphics for a printer status app. Instead, I asked questions—and uncovered a business-critical user problem.

The Real Problem

Resellers avoided carrying Xerox printers due to low margins and no guarantee of future supplies revenue. The true challenge: making it effortless for customers to reorder from the original vendor.

Innovation

I proposed an end-to-end system that:

  • Alerts users when supplies are low
  • Identifies the exact printer and original reseller
  • Redirects to the correct vendor site — with one click

No configuration. No guesswork. Just results.

Announced in Europe, it sparked enthusiastic vendor interest and helped drive third-party distribution.

User Experience

A subtle notification appears when toner is low. One click on “Order Supplies” opens the original reseller’s site—pre-loaded with the correct part numbers.

Invisible to the user: A background app encodes the printer’s serial number into a URL, Xerox servers look up the reseller, and the browser redirects seamlessly.

Patented Innovation

Directing Post-Sale Supplies Revenue to Original Dealer

U.S. Patent 8,046,264 • Issued Oct 25, 2011 • Inventors: Gary Davis, Campbell David

“A seamless bridge from device need to trusted vendor—zero friction.”
